title: CIA Spy Aldrich Ames Dies in Prison at 84

The double agent compromised more than 100 operations and betrayed more than 30 agents spying for the West.

title: Trump Renews Greenland Acquisition Push
snippets: Greenland, a vast and sparsely populated self-governing Danish territory, has been thrust into the geopolitical spotlight once again.
President Trump has repeated his interest in taking the semiautonomous Danish territory, citing U.S. national security. Denmark’s leader says such a move would be the end of NATO.
President Trump has said since his first term that he wants to acquire Greenland, and he asked aides for an updated plan on Monday. European leaders reject the president’s assertions.
Leaders of Greenland, a semi-autonomous territory within the Kingdom of Denmark, have repeatedly shot down the idea of U.S. ownership or control of the island.

US refuses to rule out military force to take control. This is why an attack on Nato ally would end alliance. And what do Greenlanders think? Greenland's leaders and European officials have firmly rejected any possibility of U.S. ownership or control. Denmark's leader stated that such a move would end NATO, and European leaders continue to oppose Trump's assertions.

Alex Nedeljkovic made 34 saves on the night, Alexander Wennberg added a goal and three points to his season tally, and the San Jose Sharks took a 5-2 win over the Columbus Blue Jackets.
Berkly Catton had two goals, Jared McCann had a goal and an assist, and Vince Dunn had two assists as the Seattle Kraken beat the Boston Bruins 7-4.
